meanings.definition: A curve or geometric figure, each part of which has the same statistical character as the whole.
meanings.sent1: The artist's painting was filled with colorful fractals.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study fractals to understand patterns in nature.
meanings.sent3: The fractals on the butterfly's wings seemed to dance in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a maze of interconnected fractals, each leading to a different memory.
meanings.sent5: The fractals in the snowflake sparkled like tiny diamonds under the microscope.

meanings.definition: Any complex pattern that is self-replicating across different scales.
meanings.sent1: The city's skyline resembled a collection of urban fractals.
meanings.sent2: Fractals in nature can be seen in the branching of trees and rivers.
meanings.sent3: The fractals in the clouds seemed to form secret messages only birds could read.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts echoed like fractals, repeating the same patterns over and over.
meanings.sent5: The music was a symphony of fractals, each note building upon the last in perfect harmony.
